greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/gcd(n, 256).
comment: a(n) first differs from A000265(n) at n = 512. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 23 2018

A multiplicative sequence. Also, a(n) is a strong divisibility sequence, that is, gcd(a(n),a(m)) = a(gcd(n,m)) for n >= 1, m >= 1. In particular, a(n) is a divisibility sequence: if n divides m then a(n) divides a(m). - _Peter Bala_, Feb 27 2019
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
P. Bala, A note on the sequence of numerators of a rational function
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, order 512.
formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-256) - a(n-512). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 26 2016
program: (Sage) [n/gcd(n, 2^8) for n in (1..80)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 27 2019
(GAP) List([1..80], n-> n/Gcd(n, 2^8)); # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 27 2019
results.author: _Artur Jasinski_, Aug 24 2016
